text.p: September BTPs futures on LIFFE are gearing up for a challenge of the 136.38 range high on Tuesday but will find their efforts thwarted beyond there, technical analysts said.
"I think it will go and have a look at the top of the range," said Susan Rigg, technical analyst at Chart Analysis in London.
The contract hit a high of 136.38 on August 12, the top of a broad sideways trading pattern since tumbling from a 138.05 high on July 31.
BTPs were quoted at 135.92 at 0807 GMT, up 0.40 on the day.
But Rigg said the speed with which the contract fell from the high suggests that peak will remain unchallenged for now and more consoldiation above 136.38 was necessary.
A breakdown above 136.38 would put support at 134.65/70 into the frame, Rigg said. This area incorporates the August 18 low.
Technical analysts at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell in London said before 136.38, BTPs need to tackle 135.92, a 38.2 percent retracement of the slide from July 23.
A 50 percent retracement of the same move gives resistance at 136.40, close to that 136.38 key high, they said in a note.
They added it would take a confirmed break of the low at 134.73 on August 6, then the potential top neckline at 134.34 to confirm the overall downside bias.
At the short end, December Eurolire were quoted at 93.58, up five basis points on the day, having barged through minor down trendline resistance at 93.55 in early trade.
Next upside target was 93.61 the high on August 7.
